title: Spending Natural Resource Revenues in an Altruistic Growth Model
plaintext: Spending Natural Resource Revenues in an Altruistic Growth Model Elisabeth Hermann Frederiksencid:3University of Copenhagen, EPRU,yand FAMEz 26 September 2006Abstract This paper examines how revenues from a natural resource interact withgrowth and welfare in an overlapping generations model with altruism. Therevenues are allocated between public productive services and direct transfersto members of society by spending policies. We analyze how these policiesincid:135uence the dynamics, and how the dynamics are incid:135uenced by the abundance of the revenue. Abundant revenues may harm growth, but growth andwelfare can be oppositely aected. We also provide the socially optimal policy.
